content:
Doing a longer bike ride this weekend sounds like a great idea! Given your current training plan, a 30-40 mile ride can be a great way to build endurance and confidence on the bike.

Considering your schedule, I think you can incorporate this longer ride into your plan. Since you're doing a group bike ride on Saturday, you could swap the scheduled 60-minute bike ride on Sunday with this longer ride. This way, you'll still be getting in some quality bike time, but you'll also be allowing yourself to recover and adapt to the increased distance.

Here's a revised plan for the weekend:

| Day | Time | Workout | Duration |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Sat | 7:00 am | Group Bike Ride (social) | 60 min |
| Sun | 7:00 am | Bike Ride (long, 30-40 miles) | 2-3 hours |

Just make sure to:

1. Fuel properly: Make sure to eat a balanced meal the night before and have a light breakfast with plenty of carbohydrates and hydration before the ride.
2. Pace yourself: Don't try to push too hard, especially if you're not used to riding longer distances. Take it easy, and focus on enjoying the ride.
3. Bring necessary gear: Pack water, snacks, and any other essentials you might need during the ride.
4. Listen to your body: If you start feeling fatigued or experiencing discomfort, it's okay to turn back or shorten the ride. Remember, recovery is just as important as training.

By incorporating this longer ride, you'll be able to build endurance and get a sense of what it's like to ride longer distances. Just be sure to recover properly afterwards, and don't forget to stretch and refuel after the ride!

How does this revised plan sound?
